dublinCore.dc:title: 119 S778 RS: Lactation Spaces for Veteran Moms Act
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Ms. Rosen (for herself and Ms. Murkowski) introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on Veterans’ Affairs
Reported by Mr. Moran, with an amendment
action.action-instruction: Strike out all after the enacting clause and insert the part printed in italic

form.official-title: To amend title 38, United States Code, to require a lactation space in each medical center of the Department of Veterans Affairs.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Lactation Spaces for Veteran Moms Act.

section.header: Lactation spaces in medical centers of the Department of Veterans Affairs

subsection.text: Subchapter II of chapter 17 of title 38, United States Code, is amended by adding at the end the following new section:

section.header: Lactation spaces in medical centers of the Department

subsection.text: The Secretary shall ensure that each medical center of the Department contains a lactation space.
Nothing in this section shall be construed to authorize an individual to enter a medical center of the Department or portion thereof that the individual is not otherwise authorized to enter.
In this section, the term lactation space means a hygienic place, other than a bathroom, that—

paragraph.text: is accessible to disabled individuals (including such individuals who use wheelchairs);
contains a chair and a working surface;
is clearly identified with signage; and
is available for use by women veterans and members of the public to express breast milk.

subsection.text: The table of sections at the beginning of such chapter is amended by inserting after the item related to section 1720L the following new item:

toc.toc-entry: 1720M. Lactation spaces in medical centers of the Department.

subsection.text: The Secretary of Veterans Affairs shall carry out section 1720M of title 38, United States Code, as added by this section, not later than two years after the date of the enactment of this Act.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Lactation Spaces for Veteran Moms Act.

section.header: Lactation spaces in medical centers of the Department of Veterans Affairs

subsection.text: Subchapter II of chapter 17 of title 38, United States Code, is amended by adding at the end the following new section:

section.header: Lactation spaces in medical centers of the Department

subsection.text: The Secretary shall ensure that each medical center of the Department contains a lactation space.
Nothing in this section shall be construed to authorize an individual to enter a medical center of the Department or portion thereof that the individual is not otherwise authorized to enter.
In this section, the term lactation space means a hygienic place, other than a bathroom, that—

paragraph.text: is accessible to disabled individuals (including such individuals who use wheelchairs);
contains a chair and a working surface;
is clearly identified with signage; and
is available for use by women veterans and members of the public to express breast milk.

subsection.text: The table of sections at the beginning of such chapter is amended by inserting after the item related to section 1720L the following new item:

toc.toc-entry: 1720M. Lactation spaces in medical centers of the Department.

subsection.text: The Secretary of Veterans Affairs shall ensure that—

paragraph.text: not later than two years after the date of the enactment of this Act, not fewer than 80 percent of medical centers of the Department of Veterans Affairs are in compliance with section 1720M of title 38, United States Code, as added by subsection (a); and
not later than three years after such date of enactment, all medical centers of the Department are in compliance with such section.

Not later than one year after the date of the enactment of this Act, and annually thereafter, the Secretary of Veterans Affairs shall submit to the Committee on Veterans’ Affairs of the Senate and the Committee on Veterans’ Affairs of the House of Representatives a report on the progress of the Secretary in meeting the requirements under section 1720M of title 38, United States Code, as added by subsection (a), including—

subparagraph.text: a list of which medical centers of the Department of Veterans Affairs currently have a lactation space;
a list of which medical centers of the Department do not have a lactation space; and

for each medical center listed under subparagraph (B), a description of actions the Department has taken to design and plan a lactation space and a timeline for such lactation space to be fully functional and open for use within the time periods specified under subsection (c).

paragraph.text: The Secretary is not required to submit a report under paragraph (1) on or after the date on which the Secretary confirms in a report submitted under such paragraph that each medical center of the Department contains a lactation space.
